text: We will hear arguments next in 75-811, Swain v. Pressley.
Mr. Chief Justice, may it please the Court.

Well, it does not this there are little more to the equal protection argument then you suggest in that prisoners who are convicted in any of the state forums, which are presumably legitimate nonetheless have the right to petitioner Federal District Court for habeas and affect someone convicted in the District of Columbia Court is the only person who does not have the right to petition to Federal District Court for habeas.

I think Mr. Justice Rehnquist that that is the argument as I understand, but I think the argument necessarily rest upon the premise that even in the District of Columbia where the Congress has special powers under Section 1.
Mr. Chief Justice, and may it please the court.
Just the minor thing Mr. Chief Justice.
One other circuit I think that might be, unless the Supreme Court here spoken Mr. Chief Justice which case and again be unconstitutional.
